hanzi-su-wiki:
択

Значения

Выбирать, отбирать

Мнемоника

Сокращение. Отбирать — это контролировать 尺 руками 扌. Что-то взять, а что-то — отложить в сторону.

Варианты

擇, 择
purpleculture_pinyin:
zé
Japanese variant of 择
Японский вариант
rtega_mnemonic:
擇擇RS
择择		択select, choose, pick out
  • inquisitive 睪/𠬤 hand 扌
  • hand 扌 or foot 尺 looking for something, wanting to pick it out
  • ⓢ two 二 hands 扌又 picking a line 丨
heisig_constituent: choose, finger, fingers, shaku-hachi, flag, stick
koohiiStory2: Depending on where you choose to put your fingers, the shakuhachi will produce a different note.
jp_example_words:
採択(さいたく): adoption, selection, choice
選択(せんたく): selection, choice
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Shove your fingers into a bowl of shrimp to select the best one. You know your shrimp and you know them well, so you won't settle for anything less than the best. Put your whole arm in there and feel around until you can select the one you want most.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Feel your fingers touching each and every shrimp, one by one, until they graze the one you select as the perfect shrimp. Slowly pull it out and lower it into your mouth. Munch munch... ahhh! The perfect shrimp.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You do this at every restaurant, party, and indoor sporting event and people start getting wise to your shrimp selection methods. One day, as you attempt to select your shrimp, a sharp pain shoots through your finger. Ow! You pull your hand back to find... a tack (たく)!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Oh, woe is me! How will I select the perfect shrimp with my fingers if there are tacks in the shrimp bowls! Boohoohoo!
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 沢 (さわ、うるおす、タク блеск, яркость, великолепие; болото, трясина).
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the shaku (尺) in your hand (扌) is your selection

Name meaning

zé
яп. вм. 择
Radicals: 扌, 尺  (fingers, shrimp)
Meaning Mnemonic
Shove your fingers into a bowl of shrimp to select the best one. You know your shrimp and you know them well, so you won't settle for anything less than the best. Put your whole arm in there and feel around until you can select the one you want most.
Feel your fingers touching each and every shrimp, one by one, until they graze the one you select as the perfect shrimp. Slowly pull it out and lower it into your mouth. Munch munch... ahhh! The perfect shrimp.
Reading Mnemonic
You do this at every restaurant, party, and indoor sporting event and people start getting wise to your shrimp selection methods. One day, as you attempt to select your shrimp, a sharp pain shoots through your finger. Ow! You pull your hand back to find... a tack (たく)!
Oh, woe is me! How will I select the perfect shrimp with my fingers if there are tacks in the shrimp bowls! Boohoohoo!
